description.en: The course will provide a survey of the major developments in 20th century British literature from Modernist poetry and prose to today's multicultural and multiethnic writing. The main emphasis will be on reading and discussing texts by a range of representative authors, including Virginia Woolf, W.H. Auden, William Golding and Salman Rushdie among others. The course will end in an oral examination.
description.et:
Kursus annab ülevaate olulisematest arengutest 20. sajandi Briti kirjanduses alates modernistlikust proosast ja luulest kuni tänapäeva multikultuurse ja paljurahvuselise kirjanduseni. Kursuse põhirõhk on representatiivsete autorite tekstide lugemisel, käsitlemisele tulevad nt Virgina Woolf, W.H.Auden, William Golding, Salman Rushdie jpt.
Kursus lõpeb suulise eksamiga.

objectives.en: The aim of the course is to give a survey of 20th century British literature starting from the Modernist movement to the turn of the millennium. The course will provide insights into the period's literary history and enhance the student's skills of critical discussion, reflection and comparison as of modern poetry and fiction.
objectives.et: Kursuse eesmärk on anda ülevaade 20. sajandi briti kirjandusest alates modernistlikust liikumisest uue aastatuhande künniseni, tutvustada selle ajalugu ning süvendada kirjandusteoste analüüsimise ning seoste loomise oskusi.

learning_outcomes.en: After completing the course the students will
1) have obtained a survey of the British literary history in the 20th century
learning_outcomes.et: 1) omavad ülevaadet briti kirjanduse ajaloost 20. sajandil;

learning_outcomes.en: 2) have acquired a toolkit of critical terms relevant to the period
learning_outcomes.et: 2) on tuttavad perioodiga seotud kirjandusteadusliku mõistestikuga;

learning_outcomes.en: 3) have improved their skills of close reading of fiction and poetry
learning_outcomes.et: 3) on harjutanud luule- ja proosatekstide praktilist lähilugemist.
